chief.note: Delivered credentials in private audience, Dec 14, 1880; was not formally received. The Romanian Foreign Ministry, however, had indicated on Aug 13, 1880, a willingness to enter provisionally into relations with the U.S. Legation.

ended.note: Reaccredited when Romania became a kingdom; presented new credentials on May 16, 1881, when Romania became a kingdom; promoted to Minister Resident/Consul General

chief.note: When promoted to Minister Resident/Consul General, was also accredited to Greece and Serbia; transferred residence to Athens.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 13, 1886. Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 19, 1889. Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 23, 1891. Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Served at Athens, but did not present credentials in Romania under any of his commissions, all of which were to Romania, Serbia, and Greece.
Served at Athens, but did not present credentials in Romania under any of his commissions, all of which were to Romania, Serbia, and Greece.
Served at Athens, but did not present credentials in Romania under any of his commissions, all of which were to Romania, Serbia, and Greece.
Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.

ended.note: Recommissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 14, 1899. Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Also accredited to Greece and Serbia; resident at Athens.

ended.note: Recommissioned to a different combination of countries

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 8, 1902. Commissioned to Greece, Romania, and Serbia; resident at Athens.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Also commissioned to Greece and Serbia; declined appointment.

Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Greece, Romania, and Serbia and Diplomatic Agent to Bulgaria; resident at Athens. Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Nov 16, 1903.
Commissioned to Romania and Serbia; resident at Bucharest.

ended.note: Recommissioned to a different combination of countries

chief.note: Commissioned to Romania and Serbia; resident at Bucharest.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 12, 1907. Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania and Serbia and Diplomatic Agent in Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest.
Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania and Serbia and Diplomatic Agent in Bulgaria; took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania and Serbia and Diplomatic Agent in Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest.

ended.note: Recommissioned with a new title in Bulgaria

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania and Serbia and Diplomatic Agent in Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest; recommissioned on Dec 13, 1909, after confirmation.
Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania, Serbia, and Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest.
Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania, Serbia, and Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest.
Commissioned as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Romania, Serbia, and Bulgaria; resident at Bucharest.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Dec 17, 1925.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 23, 1929.
Gunther died at Bucharest, Dec 22, 1941.

ended.note: Presented new credentials on Mar 11, 1948, when Romania became a republic; left post May 24, 1950

chief.note: James W. Gantenbein served as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim, Sep 1950-Nov 1952.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jun 4, 1953.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 25, 1956.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 30, 1962.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on Jan 18, 1965. John P. Shaw was serving as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim when the Legation in Bucharest was raised to Embassy status on Jun 1, 1964.
Commissioned to the Socialist Republic of Romania.
Commissioned to the Socialist Republic of Romania.
